title: Student found dead in gorge is 'fourth suicide' at same top university since start of academic year
text:

A student found dead in a gorge beneath a 330ft bridge is thought to have been the fourth at one of Britain's top universities to kill themselves in as many months. 
The body of 23-year-old Lara Nosiru, who in her final year of a neuroscience degree at the University of Bristol , was found following a two-hour search of Avon Gorge on Monday. 
Police, firefighters and coastguards launched the search after a woman was seen jumping from the city's Clifton Suspension Bridge. 
Three other Bristol University students - Daniel Green, 18, Kim Long, 18 and Miranda Williams, 19 - have taken their own lives since the start of the academic year in September. Police launched a search of Avon Gorge after a woman was seen jumping off Clifton Suspension Bridge (Photo: Getty) 
The university has launched a review into student mental health issues after the three freshers were found dead at halls of residence just weeks into their first term. 
Lara, who was a member of dancing groups in Bristol, was originally from Essex and attended Ockenden School before moving away for university. Read More Top university investigating suspected suicides of three students in just two months since the start of term 
A spokesman for the University of Bristol said: "Sadly, we can confirm that one of our final year students was found dead on Monday, January 30. 
"The student's next-of-kin have been informed, and our thoughts are with her family and friends at this difficult time. Kim Long, 18, is thought to have taken his own life last year (Photo: Facebook) 
"The welfare of our students and staff continues to be our highest priority and it is distressing for all members of the university community that one of our students has died. 
"We would urge any students affected by this tragic incident to seek support from University Services, friends or family. Read More Student whose depression 'robbed him of his lust for life' killed himself after split with girlfriend 
"Information about where to seek help is available via our homepage for current students." 
Last month, an inquest heard Daniel Green killed himself in Bristol University's Goldney Hall on October 21 after he broke up with his girlfriend. Student Miranda Williams, 19, is believed to have taken her own life last year 
The inquests of Kim Long, who died in November, and Miranda Williams, who died on October 13, are set to resume later this year. 
The university spokesman added: "Following the three student deaths reported in the autumn term, we have increased our student counselling provision. 
"We are also working closely with the Samaritans and other experts to support the university community. 
"We will continue to work with our students to improve our support for their well-being and mental health. Bristol University has launched a review of student mental health issues (Photo: Getty) 
"In the context of increasing national concerns about student mental health we began a review of our support for students last summer, working with our Students' Union. 
"We have already committed to invest an additional Â£1m per year in enhancing support for student wellbeing and mental health. 
"The review will be completed in the spring and will recommend further enhancements to the ways that we support student wellbeing." 
Samaritans offers confidential emotional support for people who are experiencing feelings of distress, despair or suicidal thoughts. 
Call its helpline 24 hours a day, 365 days a year by dialling 116 123 if you would like to speak to someone. The number is free to call from the UK and the Republic of Ireland. 
You can also visit the Samaritans website for more information. Like us on Facebook
